examples: She took up the cudgels for women's rights.
He took up the reins of government immediately after the coup.
He should take up a hobby.
Relatives have taken up the cudgels for two British women accused of murder.
After struggling with depression for years, taking up a new hobby like painting might do Jane a world of good.
words.defineEn: to fill or occupy a particular amount of space or time
words.defineVi: để lấp đầy hoặc chiếm một lượng không gian hoặc thời gian cụ thể

examples: The wedding ceremony went off without a hitch.
No wonder some people went off the rails a bit.
The fire alarm went off, and we evacuated the building.
She went off on a tangent about what happened to her last summer.
My dad went off the deep end when he found out what I'd done.
words.defineEn: (of a gun, bomb, etc.) to be fired or to explode
words.defineVi: (của súng, bom, v.v.) được bắn hoặc phát nổ

examples: When Rachel saw David across the room, she knew that she was about to fall in love with him.
I explored Mediterranean cuisine and fell in love with the rich flavors of slow-cooked lamb shanks.
Despite being surrounded by many admirers, Martha only had eyes for Harold, the charming and kind-hearted man she had fallen in love with.
After years of being friends, Emily and Ethan finally realized they had fallen in love with each other and started dating.
When Emma and Jack met, they knew they were made for each other and quickly fell in love.
words.defineEn: to cave in or collapse inward
words.defineVi: hang động trong hoặc sụp đổ bên trong

examples: The company's new product line contributed to a significant increase in its overall yield for the quarter.
Euglena serves as a primary producer, contributing to the food chain in aquatic ecosystems.
As a citizen, it is important to belong to a community and contribute to its well-being.
Including partridgeberries in your diet can contribute to a well-rounded intake of essential vitamins and minerals.
As much as he has contributed to the company, he has outstayed his welcome and needs to go.
words.defineEn: to help to cause or be one of the causes of a situation or an event
words.defineVi: để giúp gây ra hoặc là một trong những nguyên nhân của một tình huống hoặc một sự kiện

examples: I came across a recipe that uses quark as a base for homemade ice cream.
We recently came across a wall, before that it was all going very smoothly.
As we walked through the cornfield, we came across a cob that had fallen from one of the stalks.
He looked through her belongings in the hope of coming across some information.
He looked through her belongings in the hope of coming across some information.
words.defineEn: to discover, meet, or find someone or something by accident
words.defineVi: để khám phá, đáp ứng, hoặc tìm một ai đó hoặc một cái gì đó một cách tình cờ

examples: The company's ambitious expansion plans went up in flames when their major investor pulled out.
MY wife opened her purse and pulled out a pen to write a note.
He reached into his pocket and pulled out his phone.
She felt in her bag and pulled out a pen.
Fred's pulling out all the stops for his daughter's wedding
words.defineEn: to take and bring something out
words.defineVi: để lấy và mang một cái gì đó ra

examples: When Mike comes over for dinner, he will make himself at home by offering to help in the kitchen and finding a cozy spot to relax.
So the doctor comes over.
Come over.
And this older guy comes over.
A hush comes over the anxious slaves.
words.defineEn: to come to someone’s house in order to visit them for a short time
words.defineVi: đến nhà ai đó để thăm họ trong một thời gian ngắn

examples: Hold up!
Hold up: question?
Hold up.
Hold up!
Hold up some fingers.
words.defineEn: to wait or to stop proceeding
words.defineVi: chờ đợi hoặc ngừng tiến hành

examples: I put my neck on the line to get her a job in our company, and then she turns around and tries to steal my position!
The girls in front turned around and grinned.
I put my neck on the line to get her a job in our company, and then she turns around and tries to get me fired!
Turn around.
- Turn around.
words.defineEn: to turn something or ourselves in another direction
words.defineVi: để biến một cái gì đó hoặc chính chúng ta theo một hướng khác

examples: Finally things are moving in the right direction.
She asked if she could move in.
The old man moved in his chair.
The Indian gentleman moved in his chair.
Shocked troops move in for the beach assault.
words.defineEn: to begin to live in a new house or work in a new office
words.defineVi: bắt đầu sống trong một ngôi nhà mới hoặc làm việc trong một văn phòng mới

examples: Others converted in name only, out of fear, while others stuck to their faith.
I was determined to stick to my diet, but when my coworker left a box of donuts on the table, I couldn't resist.
She found the idea of eating tongue quite unpleasant and decided to stick to her usual choices.
Despite harsh criticism, she's sticking to her guns on this issue.
By sticking to the letter of the law, the spirit of the law may be lost.
words.defineEn: to continue doing something even though there are some hardships
words.defineVi: để tiếp tục làm một cái gì đó mặc dù có một số khó khăn

examples: So now that we got the situation straight, let's look into the word in a bit more detail.
When she looked into his eyes, she could see the pain and sadness that he was trying so hard to hide.
Recently, HHS's internal investigator looked into the issue.
- Look into your camera there.
Squeaks and I are looking into an animal mystery.
words.defineEn: to investigate or explore something in order to gather information or understand it better
words.defineVi: để điều tra hoặc khám phá một cái gì đó để thu thập thông tin hoặc hiểu nó tốt hơn

examples: 'Look around this town, Sir, this great rich town.
He looked around.
He looked around.
Look around your house.
You looked around.
words.defineEn: to turn our head to see around us
words.defineVi: quay đầu lại để nhìn xung quanh chúng ta

examples: The recipe called for seven ingredients.
The recipe calls for thirty grams of sugar.
Several candidates were called for a second interview.
The recipe called for eight ounces of flour, which is about one cup.
The recipe called for a pinch of coriander seeds to enhance the taste of the soup.
words.defineEn: to make something required, necessary, or appropriate
words.defineVi: để làm cho một cái gì đó bắt buộc, cần thiết, hoặc thích hợp

examples: He writes down his ideas and thoughts in his notebook.
She always carries a small thing to write down her thoughts.
If somebody comes and says: 'Hello, I'm Mr. XYZ', then you write down the name at once.
Write down those steps.
[ticking clock] Write down your guess.
words.defineEn: to record something on a piece of paper by writing
words.defineVi: để ghi lại một cái gì đó trên một mảnh giấy bằng cách viết

examples: The plan ran into a brick wall.
The company ran into financial difficulties and had to lay off employees.
A small river runs into the sea at one side of the castle.
He kicked off his hat and ran into the ocean.
He caught a break that few aspiring screenwriters do: running into a studio boss at a party.
words.defineEn: to meet someone by chance and unexpectedly
words.defineVi: gặp ai đó một cách tình cờ và bất ngờ

examples: He fell into a trap by believing his childhood friend and giving away all of his savings.
After months of hard work and perseverance, everything fell into place for James, and he achieved his dream of starting his own business.
He sank back on his pillow and fell into a brown study.
Macbeth falls into their trap and believes that he is safer than he actually is.
was unaware that I was falling into the trap of toxic positivity.
words.defineEn: to accidentally go down into something
words.defineVi: để vô tình đi xuống vào một cái gì đó

examples: He turns heads when he walks into a room, with his charismatic personality and fashionable attire.
Lisa walked into the room and struck a pose, hoping she would be noticed.
When the man in the fancy suit walked into the biker bar, it was obvious that he was a square peg.
As I walked into the room, there she was, large as life, wearing a bright red dress that caught everyone's attention.
John was discussing his former boss when he walked into the room, and someone joked, "Speak of the devil, and he shall appear!"
words.defineEn: to become involved in something unpleasant because of carelessness or ignorance
words.defineVi: tham gia vào một cái gì đó khó chịu vì bất cẩn hoặc thiếu hiểu biết

examples: Twenty nineteens pro-democracy protests effectively shut down commerce.
The Iranian authorities shut down the internet.
This medication shuts down your estrogen and progesterone.
Today's announcement largely shut down the country through Easter and beyond.
They shut down the cafe.
words.defineEn: to stop or make something stop working
words.defineVi: để dừng lại hoặc làm cho một cái gì đó ngừng hoạt động

examples: When his head broke the surface he took in deep gulps of air.
The couple had to compromise and give and take in order to make their marriage work.
take in the glory of your surroundings.
To take in diversity.
"Transformers: Age of Extinction" took in $320 million from China, 28% of its global gross.
words.defineEn: to accommodate or provide a place for someone to stay temporarily
words.defineVi: để chứa hoặc cung cấp một nơi cho một người nào đó để ở lại tạm thời

examples: He reached over and turned off his bedside light.
Jill must have been in another world when I asked her to turn off the oven because the bread is burned now.
"Turn off?"
Once inside, he turned off the security alarm.
Don't turn off the captions.
words.defineEn: to cause a machine, device, or equipment to stop operating, typically by pushing a button or turning a key
words.defineVi: làm cho máy móc, thiết bị hoặc thiết bị ngừng hoạt động, thường bằng cách nhấn nút hoặc vặn chìa khóa

words.defineEn: to pass, in space or time
words.defineVi: để vượt qua, trong không gian hoặc thời gian

examples: Russia, he said, had reached the point of no return on the road to reform and had to go forward.
- Go forward.
Right now and then going forward, as well?
So what do you do going forward?
Now what do we do going forward?
words.defineEn: to go or travel onward in space or time
words.defineVi: đi hoặc du hành về phía trước trong không gian hoặc thời gian

examples: The ancient castle has stood for over a century, preserving its grandeur and history for hundreds of years.
It flies in the teeth of everything we stand for!
The bus was full, so I had to stand for the entire journey.
These letters stand for Magnetic Resonance Imaging.
PARE stands for Physical Ability Requirement Evaluation.
words.defineEn: to represent something in the form of an abbreviation or symbol
words.defineVi: để đại diện cho một cái gì đó ở dạng viết tắt hoặc ký hiệu

examples: The young entrepreneur had a new business idea every week and jumped from venture to venture without sticking with any for long.
That name sticks with you.
Those things stick with you.
Sometimes really bad things stick with people.
But most American voters stuck with the two main parties.
words.defineEn: to continue doing something
words.defineVi: để tiếp tục làm một cái gì đó
